isis.stitle: RADIATOR, REMOVE AND REPLACE - MXT - COMPONENT AND RADIATOR REMOVal - SURGE TANK

svcproc.title: SURGE TANK
svcproc.para: The surge tank on the MXT model vehicles is located on the driver's side radiator frame.

step1.para: Check tank for coolant; drain if necessary by disconnecting the bottom hose to the thermostat housing (Figure 8).

figure.caption: Figure 8. Surge Tank Mounted to Bracket with All Hoses Attached

step1.para: Loosen the compression clamp securing the upper radiator surge hose at the radiator and disconnect the hose (Figure 9).
Loosen the compression clamp securing the overflow surge hose at the overflow bottle and disconnect the hose (Figure 9).
Loosen the compression clamp securing the surge hose to the upper engine fitting and disconnect, if necessary.

note.para: The upper engine fitting surge hose does not need to be disconnected. The hoses do not need to be disconnected at the surge tank because, once drained with the bolts removed, the tank can be "moved over", NOT "removed." The surge tank can rest, out of the way, on top of the engine.

step1.para: Loosen and remove all four surge tank mounting bolts from surge tank mounting bracket (Figure 10).
Move or remove the surge tank (Figure 11). (See NOTE above with Step 4.)

figure.caption: Figure 10. Surge Tank Mounting Bracket and Four Bolts
